intro: Luma macromischa, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves that are often used for weaving. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. Luma macromischa is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. It plays an important role in traditional Māori culture and has ecological significance in its native habitat.
